parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
A horse. Of uncertain affinity; a horse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A bow. From the base of tikto; a bow.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To conquer, be victorious, overcome, prevail, subdue. From nike; to subdue.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To conquer, be victorious, overcome, prevail, subdue. From nike; to subdue.
